name: Do not use EQUIVALENCE in Modules  (FORTRAN)
description: The number of EQUIVALENCE statements are counted per artifact; whenever the artifact has 1 or more occurences of this statement, it is considered as being in violation. The number of EQUIVALENCE statements is presented in the value of the violated artifact.
rationale: Use of the instruction EQUIVALENCE is forbidden.
remediation: Reduce the number of EQUIVALENCE statements, or seek alternatives to this statement
alternativeName: Do not use EQUIVALENCE in Modules  (FORTRAN)

technicalCriteria.name: PCI-DSS4-Requirement-6.3.2 - An inventory of bespoke and custom software, and third-party software components incorporated into bespoke and custom software is maintained to facilitate vulnerability and patch management.
PCI-Requirement-6.2 - Ensure all Systems and Software are Protected from Known Vulnerabilities

qualityStandards.name: Ensure all Systems and Software are Protected from Known Vulnerabilities
Ensure all Systems and Software are Protected from Known Vulnerabilities
An inventory of bespoke and custom software, and third-party software components incorporated into bespoke and custom software is maintained to facilitate vulnerability and patch management.
